title: Google\Cloud\Retail\V2\Rating
name: Rating
description:
The rating of a [Product][google.cloud.retail.v2.Product].

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.retail.v2.Rating

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.rating_count
params.description: The total number of ratings. This value is independent of the value of [rating_histogram][google.cloud.retail.v2.Rating.rating_histogram]. This value must be nonnegative. Otherwise, an INVALID_ARGUMENT error is returned.

params.name: data.average_rating
params.description: The average rating of the [Product][google.cloud.retail.v2.Product]. The rating is scaled at 1-5. Otherwise, an INVALID_ARGUMENT error is returned.

params.name: data.rating_histogram
params.description: List of rating counts per rating value (index = rating - 1). The list is empty if there is no rating. If the list is non-empty, its size is always 5. Otherwise, an INVALID_ARGUMENT error is returned. For example, [41, 14, 13, 47, 303]. It means that the [Product][google.cloud.retail.v2.Product] got 41 ratings with 1 star, 14 ratings with 2 star, and so on.

methods.name: getRatingCount
methods.description:
The total number of ratings. This value is independent of the value of [rating_histogram][google.cloud.retail.v2.Rating.rating_histogram].

This value must be nonnegative. Otherwise, an INVALID_ARGUMENT error is returned.

Generated from protobuf field int32 rating_count = 1;

methods.name: getRatingHistogram
methods.description:
List of rating counts per rating value (index = rating - 1). The list is empty if there is no rating. If the list is non-empty, its size is always 5. Otherwise, an INVALID_ARGUMENT error is returned.

For example, [41, 14, 13, 47, 303]. It means that the [Product][google.cloud.retail.v2.Product] got 41 ratings with 1 star, 14 ratings with 2 star, and so on.

Generated from protobuf field repeated int32 rating_histogram = 3;
